state_summary: The H-1B visa program's fee hike to $100,000 may hurt innovation and competitiveness of smaller startups compared to big businesses.
evidence: Amr Awadallah, founder of AI startup Vectara, says the fee is too high for many startups
Critics note that this visa helped bring in people who have gone on to start or run multibillion-dollar companies
The visa has been more accessible than the O-1 visa for extraordinary ability, and quicker to obtain than a green card
keywords: H-1B visa, startup founders, innovation, competitiveness, fee hike
